brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate in subjects with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease the direct effects of a
      Chinese herb formula.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical Trail Of NAFLD Treated By Traditional Chinese Medicine

detailed_description.textblock:
1) Liver fat (measured by CT scan) and liver function assessed by liver enzymes levels; 2)
      Insulin sensitivity measured by HOMA index, oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) and a
      euglycaemic hyperinsulinaemic clamp (with stable isotopes) in a subset of the subjects; 3)
      Plasma lipid profile and non esterified fatty acids (NEFA) concentration; 4) Circulating
      levels of adipokines.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects with NAFLD(nonalcoholic fatty liver disease) (criteria of Society of
             Hepatology, Chinese Medical Association, 2002.10),

          -  aged 18-65

          -  alcohol consumption less than 40g/week;

          -  liver/spleen (L/S) ratio no more than 1 by CT scan.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ALT more than twice the upper end of the normal range

          -  viral hepatitis

          -  total parenteral alimentation or secondary liver disease such as hepatocirrhosis,
             autoimmune hepatitis, metabolic liver disease or drug induced liver disease

          -  severe cardiovascular or renal dysfunction

          -  Subjects with diabetes (fasting glucose more than or equal to 7.0mmol/L or
             postprandial glucose more than or equal to 11.1mmol/L)

          -  Subjects treated with statins

clinical_study.official_title: The Clinical Trail Of NAFLD Treated By Traditional Chinese Medicine

overall_official.affiliation: Huashan Hospital, affliated to Fudan University

primary_outcome.description: CT imaging has been used to assess hepatic steatosis and has been validated in relation to liver biopsy .The ratio of liver to spleen (L/S ratio) for CT attenuation values is an index, with a L/S ratio<1 considered to represent fatty liver .

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Liver function enzymes- alanine aminotransferase (ALT,U/L), aspartate aminotransferase (AST,U/L) and γ-glutamyltransferase (GGT,U/L) and total bilirubin (TBI,μmol/L), albumin/globin (A/G)(Automatic biochemical analyzer)

Plasma lipids including triglyceride (TG,mmol/L), total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL.mmol/L), high-density lipoprotein (HDL,mmol/L), apolipoprotein A (ApoA,mmol/L), apolipoprotein B (ApoB,mmol/L) and lipoprotein (a) (Lp(a),mmol/L). (Automatic biochemical analyzer)
Insulin sensitivity of lipolysis using NEFA concentrations(μmol/L).(Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay)
high sensitivity C-reactive protein(mg/L,Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
